title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: Find answers to common questions about our bug fixing services

faqs.question: What types of bugs do you fix?
faqs.answer: We fix a wide range of software bugs including functional errors, compatibility issues, performance problems, UI/UX glitches, security vulnerabilities, database errors, API integration issues, and cross-browser/cross-platform bugs for both businesses and individual developers.

faqs.question: How quickly can you resolve my software bugs?
faqs.answer: Our turnaround time depends on the complexity of the bug. Simple issues are typically resolved within 24-48 hours, while more complex bugs may take 3-5 business days. For urgent fixes, we offer priority service with expedited resolution times.

faqs.question: What is your bug fixing process?
faqs.answer: Our process includes: 1) Bug identification and analysis, 2) Reproduction of the issue in our test environment, 3) Root cause analysis, 4) Fix development and testing, 5) Implementation of the solution, and 6) Post-fix verification to ensure the problem is completely resolved.

faqs.question: Do you provide warranties on your bug fixes?
faqs.answer: Yes, all our bug fixes come with a 30-day warranty. If the same issue reoccurs within this period, we'll fix it at no additional cost. We also provide detailed documentation of the fixes implemented to help prevent future issues.

faqs.question: Can you fix bugs in any programming language or framework?
faqs.answer: We have expertise in fixing bugs across multiple languages and frameworks including JavaScript, Python, PHP, Java, C#, Ruby, React, Angular, Vue.js, Laravel, Django, and many others. Our team of specialized developers can handle bugs in most modern development environments.

faqs.question: How do I submit a bug for you to fix?
faqs.answer: You can submit bugs through our online portal, where you'll provide details about the issue, steps to reproduce it, and relevant code snippets or error messages. For larger projects, we offer a comprehensive code review service to identify and fix multiple bugs simultaneously.
